topic.title: Deploying the Operator Interface in Production

body.p: Deploy the operator interface (OI) to run in a production environment, including installing the required packages, connecting the OI to the server, configuring the station/lot settings, etc.

ol.li: In TestStand, select Semiconductor Module>>Configure Station.
In the General tab, select Enable Handlder/Prober Driver (Real or Simulated).

Select an appropriate handler/prober driver for your handler or prober from the pull-down menu.
If you do not have access to a real handler, select Built-in Simulated Handler Driver to simulate handler functions. For more information about which driver to select, ask NI engineers for help.

section.title: Enabling STDF Log for Processing Test Results
section.p: Note If this configuration is not done, the OI throws an error Datalog does not exist. Call mechanical engineer and platform test engineer. after you click the Save Test Results button.

ol.li: In TestStand, select Semiconductor Module>>Configure Station.
In the Advanced tab, select Result Processing.
If the STDF Log option is not listed in the Output Name column, click the right arrow on the top right and select STDF Log from the list.
Verify that the STDF Log option is listed in the Output Name column and place a checkmark in the Enabled column.

section.title: Connecting the OI to Server
section.p: You must connect the OI to a test program server and a test data server so that it can download test program from and upload test data to the correct locations.

ol.li: Update the [server_data_IP_1] variable values to match the test data server you are connecting to. For example, change the server_data_IP_1 value to the IP address of your server and confirm the customer ID value is correct.

To connect to a second test data server for another customer, complete the following steps:
Update the server_data_FTP_count value to 2.If the server_data_FTP_count value is 1, the OI saves the test data to the first test data server even if you have configured a second test data server.
Update the [server_data_IP_2] variable values to match the second test data server you are connecting to. For example, change the server_data_IP_2 value to the IP address of your second server and confirm the customer ID value is correct.

Update the [server_pmg_IP] variable values to match the test program server you are connecting to. For example, change the server_pmg_IP value to the IP address of your server and confirm the customer ID value is correct.
